channel.title: They fought alone
channel.description:
Drama series on pioneering individuals produced at University of Michigan

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Joseph Lancaster
item.description: In 19th century England, Joseph Lancaster champions the rights of the poor to an education.
item.dc:creator: Bassett, Anita
item.dc:subject: Educators--Great Britain--Biography.

item.title: German rocket scientists go west
item.description: German rocket scientists "go with the West" to find the freedom to pursue knowledge for its own sake.
item.dc:creator: Bassett, Anita
item.dc:subject: Rocketry--History--20th century.

item.title: Galileo
item.description: Galileo fights for the freedom to announce new scientific theories.
item.dc:creator: Willis, Edgar E.
item.dc:subject: Galilei, Galileo, 1564-1642--Adversaries.

item.title: Michael Servetus
item.description: Michael Servetus challenges the medical dogma of the church and is burned at the stake.
item.dc:creator: Foshko, Robert
item.dc:subject: Theologians--Spain.

item.title: Norwegian teachers resist Nazis
item.description: Norwegian teachers rebel against the Nazi Laerersamband.
item.dc:creator: Bassett, Anita
item.dc:subject: World War, 1939-1945--Norway--Bergen.

item.title: Captain Richard Pratt
item.description: Captain Richard Pratt champions the rights of Native Americans to an education.
item.dc:creator: Bassett, Anita
item.dc:subject: United States Indian School (Carlisle, Pa.)

item.title: Franklin Jameson
item.description: Franklin Jameson declares teachers must have the rights of all free citizens and be permitted to hold beliefs that run contrary to ones prevalent in their communities.
item.dc:creator: Burrows, E.G.
item.dc:subject: Intellectual freedom.
